title: Drawing, "The Dressing Room of King Ludwig I at the Munich Residence Palace", 1836
medium: Brush and gouache, gold paint, pen and black ink, graphite on white wove paper
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; Galerie Biederman, Munich
dimensions:
Old frame H x W x D: 41.9 x 48.3 x 2.5 cm (16 1/2 in. x 19 in. x 1 in.)
Sheet: 22.1 x 28.6 cm (8 11/16 x 11 1/4 in.)
description: The new wing (Königsbau) of the Munich Residence Palace was built by architect Leo von Klenze in 1826-35 in imitation of the Pitti Palace in Florence. King Ludwig's dressing room, in the new wing, with vaulted and coffered ceiling, was painted with scenes from classical literature and poetry. The geometric floor covering recalls the ceiling pattern. Painted wall decoration is derived from Raphael's Vatican Loggie in the grotesque style. Von Klenze designed the gold and white furniture.

exhibitions.title: House Proud: 19th Century Watercolor Interiors from the Thaw Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Dressing Room of King Ludwig I at the Munich Residence Palace", 1836.
1836. Brush and gouache, gold paint, pen and black ink, graphite on white wove paper. Thaw Collection. 2007-27-18.
